newsitem.title: GERMANY: MSNBC says will broadcast interactively in Germany.
newsitem.headline: MSNBC says will broadcast interactively in Germany.

text.p: U.S. news television channel MSNBC said on Friday evening that it planned to broadcast its interactive programmes in Germany and neighbouring countries from Monday.
In a statement released in Hamburg, the station said the that viewers would be able to participate in a talk show by sending in questions for the guests over their home personal computer.

MSNBC is a joint venture between NBC and Microsoft and its owners claim it is the world's first interactive television channel. It has been broadcast in the United States by satellite and on the internet since July.
MSNBC said that extra information on subjects discussed in the programme would also be available on-line.
MSNBC plans to start broadcasting a channel specially designed for the European market in the second half of 1997.
